abstract.p: Jalen Rose remains confident despite Indiana Pacers' 91-89 loss to New York Knickerbockers (S)

block.p: Jalen Rose remained confident despite the Pacers' 91-89 loss last night.

''I'm disappointed but not concerned,'' Rose said after the Knicks tied the Eastern Conference finals at two games apiece. ''I'd be concerned if I was sitting here talking about why we're not going to the finals.''
Jalen Rose remained confident despite the Pacers' 91-89 loss last night.

''I'm disappointed but not concerned,'' Rose said after the Knicks tied the Eastern Conference finals at two games apiece. ''I'd be concerned if I was sitting here talking about why we're not going to the finals.''
Rose was disturbed by the officials' decision to call a lane violation with 4.1 seconds remaining, though he clearly committed the penalty.

While Latrell Sprewell was preparing to miss the second of two free throws, Rose stormed into the lane before Sprewell released the ball. The referee's call gave Sprewell one more shot, which he made to put the Knicks up by 4 points and end the Pacers' chances.
''It was an interesting call,'' Rose said. ''You watch basketball all the time. How many times have you seen that call?''
